column17: The arson attack took place at the Turkish embassy in Helsinki, Helsinki province, Finland.
column18: 10/21/2008: On Tuesday early in the morning, suspected Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) rebels set fire to the Turkish embassy in Helsinki, Helsinki province, Finland, throwing several Molotov cocktails at the embassy door. The arson attack injured one person from smoke inhalation and damaged the embassy door before the fire was quickly put. Police speculated that the arson attack was carried out for political reasons. No claim of responsibility was made for the incident.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: Several Molotov cocktails were used in the arson attack.
column108: The arson attack damaged the embassy door before the fire was quickly put.
column127: \"\"Finland: Turkish Embassy Blames PKK for Helsinki Attack"
column132: \"\"One Injured in Arson Attack on Turkish Embassy in Finland"
